div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

div.h3: Welcome to the Barrington School District

br.span: The remote learning website above is THE place to go for ALL information related to our school closure and remote learning. Please check this link at least 1 time per day for critical announcement and information you need to know. It includes details on Technical Support, Breakfast & Lunch, Letters from the District & more.

In an effort to be proactive and protect any identified vulnerable populations, the Barrington School District school buildings will be closed beginning March 16, 2020. During this time we will be implementing our remote learning plan.

p.span:
IMPORTANT Kindergarten Registration Information - With our school buildings currently being closed, the Barrington School District is beginning the process of registration for Kindergarten for the 2020-2021 school year online. This is the first step you must take to begin the registration process. Once you have completed the online application, you will be contacted in the near future (exact date to be determined) by our staff to continue the process. If you are a Barrington resident and your child will be 5 years old on or before October 1, 2020, please use the link below to get started. If you have any questions, please contact Gale Coffield at gcoffield@barringtonschools.net or 856-547-8467, x118. LINK: https://genesis.genesisedu.com/barrington/openReg
Click here to view the Solar PPA presentation that was given at our March 9, 2020 Board of Education meeting.
Avon School is looking for individuals to participate in the Avon School Playground Improvement Committee. Please contact Anthony Arcodia (856-547-6632 or aarcodia@barringtonschools.net) if you are interested.
New for the upcoming school year, Barrington School District will be moving to trimesters. Find out what this means for you by reading our trimester FAQ. Report card dates are also listed within this document: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1I8blLHcAu9SkxH-L75EkV4abBYBMLygCXn8wB51pqZM/edit?ts=5d5d8ffa

br.br: If your high school student will be attending Haddon Heights High School in the Fall, (s)he will need a permit issued from the Barrington School District. This is similar to registering into a new school district. You will need to provide the following as proof of residency:

li.span: Tax bill or Deed to your home
Lease with the name of the student listed.If the student is not listed on the lease, then also bring a letter from the landlord stating that the student resides with you in the dwelling.
Utility bill with your name and address listed.

p.span: You must also show personal photo identification (photo driver's license, passport, etc.) when picking up the permit.

span.span: The permits may be obtained at Barrington Board of Education Office, 311 Reading Avenue., Barrington, NJ

p.span: Permits may be obtained beginning Monday June 24, 2019 until Thursday, August 22, 2019.
The office is closed on Fridays, and July 4, 2019.

span.br: Please call (856) 547-8467 x118 if you need to make other arrangements, or need additional information.

p.span: Thank you in advance for your cooperation.

span.style: text-align: justify; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(7, 55, 99);

span.span:
--------------------------
The Barrington School District is pleased to announce the opening of a

strong.style: color: rgb(7, 55, 99); font-size: small; text-align: justify;

span.strong: half-day Preschool Inclusion Program for the 2019-2020 school year
span.span: . The goal of the inclusion program is to integrate special needs children with typically developing peers in a collaborative learning environment. Tuition for the program is $3,000 for the school year and includes transportation for Barrington’s bus zones.

p.style: color: rgb(7, 55, 99); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: justify; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; line-height: 12.05pt;
color: rgb(7, 55, 99); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; text-align: justify; margin: 0in 0in 0.0001pt; line-height: 12.05pt;
p.span:
If you are interested in enrolling your child in the Preschool Inclusion Program, please visit our website for an application at http://specialed.barrington.site.eboard.com/
Click here to view interim and marking period/report card dates for the 2019-2020 school year.

Click here to view the 2019-2020 user friendly budget.
The Barrington School District is thrilled to continue our 1:1 Chromebook initiative. All students in grades K-8 will be provided with a Chromebook device, which is similar to a laptop. Students in grades 2-8 will be issued a Chromebook for use inside and outside of school. Students in grades K & 1 will utilize Chromebooks in their classrooms. Parents and students will be required to read, sign and return the "Student Chromebook Guidelines" usage agreement before a parent can pick up their child's Chromebook. No Chromebooks will be issued without this completed paperwork. Again, please be sure you have brought your completed usage agreement form, signed by both you and your child. The agreement can be found on the last page of this packet. After you pick up your Chromebook, it should be kept in the case that it was given to you in, at all times. Students should be using this case to bring it back and forth to school. Chargers should be left at home, and used to charge the Chromebook each night.

div.span:
Applications for Free/Reduced Meals can be submitted via the Parent Portal at http://www.barringtonschools.net/parentportal. If you are unable to complete the application online, a paper packet may be picked up at your child’s school. Click here to view detailed directions on how to complete the application online.
School hours for both Avon and Woodland are from 8:35 AM until 3:05 PM. Students should not arrive before 8:25 AM.

span.div: You can now receive text messages directly to your cell phone with important news and information from our district. These messages will include such items as reminders for school events and any weather related school delays or closings. How do you get started? Simply text @barrinfo to 81010 and follow the instructions you will receive. Or, you can click here to get started as well.
